shutdown

public void shutdown()
Description copied from interface: AudioServer
Trigger the server to shut down. This method can be called from another thread, but does not guarantee that the server is shut down at the moment it returns.

Specified by:
shutdown in interface AudioServer

create

public static JavasoundAudioServer create(javax.sound.sampled.Mixer inputMixer,
                                          javax.sound.sampled.Mixer outputMixer,
                                          AudioConfiguration context,
                                          JavasoundAudioServer.TimingMode mode,
                                          AudioClient client)
Create a JavasoundAudioServer.

Parameters:
inputMixer - Javasound mixer to use for audio input. Can be null as long as the context passed in requests no audio input channels.
outputMixer - Javasound mixer to use for audio output.
context - Requested audio configuration. Variable buffer size property is ignored.
mode - Timing mode to use. For lowest latency use TimingMode.Estimated or TimingMode.FramePosition.
client - Audio client to process every callback.
Returns:
server
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if requested context has no output channels.

create

public static JavasoundAudioServer create(java.lang.String device,
                                          AudioConfiguration context,
                                          JavasoundAudioServer.TimingMode mode,
                                          AudioClient client)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Create a JavasoundAudioServer.

Parameters:
device - Name of the device to use for audio input and output. If null or an empty String, the first (default) device that provides the required number of lines will be chosen. Otherwise a device will be searched for that contains the provided String in its name.
context - Requested audio configuration. Variable buffer size property is ignored.
mode - Timing mode to use. For lowest latency use TimingMode.Estimated or TimingMode.FramePosition.
client - Audio client to process every callback.
Returns:
server
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if requested context has no output channels, or if suitable mixers cannot be found to satisfy the device name.
